ygData.subject: Re: The Man (?) Behind the Curtain
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I don t know - EQ has this big Seattle Music Scene going on with all the bards :cough cough hack heave I checked out the Soerbaird, pretty cool idea, but
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I don't know - EQ has this big Seattle Music Scene going on with all
the bards :cough cough hack heave
I checked out the Soerbaird, pretty cool idea, but I don't know if it's for
me. I have played guitar for 14 years, but composing lyric or verse is not
my strong point. And I get all jittery in front of a crowd =) Is Jythri a
Seattlite too, then? Maybe if I sing a ballad to Billgatus of Borg I can get
a job as a drone at Microsoft, too..(seriously though, I am looking into
it).

>From: Scott Pickle <scottp@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] The Man (?) Behind the Curtain
>Date: Fri, 21 May 1999 14:26:28 -0700
>
>From: Scott Pickle <scottp@...>
>
>Geez, too many Bardic Seattlites, guess I hafta come out of the closet...
>Former WotC employee (which drew me to Seattle), current Microsoft
>employee.
>
>
>Why a bard?
>Jythri is my kindred spirit and was my roomate for 4 years in college (He
>is, BTW, an outstanding keyboardist and song writer in real life). He
>sucked
>me into EQ. It's his fault.
>
>Beyond that, I just think the Bard is a lot like me... Jack of all Trades
>and Master of None. I guess I sympathize with the plight of the bard;
>Seldom
>seen as valuable by the highly specialized, but able to move in many
>different circles very efficiently. I guess it's even more telling that my
>secondary character is a Shaman.
>
>- Dendall, Ollave of the Soerbaird on Fennin Ro
>http://www.soerbaird.com
